data.title: ViewportSprite with Material set to Lights Only affects other pixels at the same screen position
data.body:
A ViewportSprite with Material set to Lights Only affects pixels at the same screen position even when the visibility of the ViewportSprite is turned off. It also affects other ViewportSprites with material set to Lights Only, the light masks affecting the ViewportSprites adding to each other. 

In this example a ordinary 2D sprite has a 'shadow' (red dotted circle) where the light affecting the ViewportSprite with Material set to Lights Only is positioned but the visibility turned off. 
![texture_mask04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/11422835/80933236-943f-11e5-99c0-aec78b1bb7c4.png)

The ViewportSprites in the next image examples each has a 2D light with a texture mask added to them to create the desired masking effect.

In this image the two faces are ViewportSprites  with Material set to Lights Only.
![texture_mask01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/11422419/1ab07026-943c-11e5-8fde-500100f655cf.png)

In this image a third ViewportSprite with Material set to Lights Only is also affected by the masked area of the two faces.
![texture_mask02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/11422455/4bfda612-943c-11e5-8f91-dbd61af60aa1.png)

In this image the visibility of the third ViewportSprite has been turned off but its mask still affects the two faces adding to the mask 
![texture_mask03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/11422549/120c8990-943d-11e5-8c4b-7cf33f177b83.png)

data.title: Add support for non-ascii input bindings
data.body:
I do not know English (use translator). I find it hard to formulate their thoughts in English. If something (in the text below) is unclear or questionable, please give a leading question. I will try to describe more.

I started developing the game "first person" and faced a problem. Godot does not support international keyboard control. That is, the control works only when the English keyboard layout. Or I did not find the opportunity to make the control does not depend on the keyboard layout.

In the window "Projekt Settings", tab "Input Map" - it is not possible to add non-Latin characters. But even if such a possibility was - it did not solve the problem. Languages very much and can't foresee everything.

For a moment hope gave:
class_input
  bool is_key_pressed ( int scancode )

(Table scancode: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/wiki/class_@global-scope)

But it is not the keyboard codes are, the codes of entered characters. As a result, all the same error, switching the keyboard layout leads to a complete breakdown of control in the game to Godot.

This is a very serious error for develop international games. The necessary mechanism for scanning the keyboard (key codes), not that it introduces characters.

Hello everyone.

My promise is to add Ubuntu Touch support in Godot Engine. You will be the first engine, which supports UT and with Your help we can port and develop many games for that awesome platform!

data.title: Send a text without godot serialization.
data.body:
#2863

Test file .gd

```

extends Node

var server

func _ready():
    set_process(true)
    var port = 5555
    server = TCP_Server.new()

    if server.listen( port ) == 0:
        print("Server started on port " + str(port) )
        set_process( true )
    else:
        print( "Failed to start server on port " + str(port) )

func _process( delta ):
    if server.is_connection_available(): # check if someone's trying to connect
        var client = server.take_connection() # accept connection
        var rs = ""
        var cache = ""
        var end = false
        while(!end):
            cache += client.get_data(1)[1].get_string_from_utf8()
            #check end of line
            if(cache.substr(cache.length()-2,cache.length()) == "\r\n"):
                #check begin with \r\n -> end of stream
                if(cache.length()==2):
                    end = true
                else:#next line
                    rs += cache
                    cache = ""
        print(rs)
        print( "Client has connected!" )
        client.put_text( "HTTP/1.1 200 Ok\n" + "Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8\n" + "Content-Length: 0\n" + "Connection: close\n" + "\r\n" )
        client.disconnect()
```

data.title: HTTPClient: app is crashed when connection terminated by remote side (maybe not)
data.body:
![godot_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7677575/11371515/fa70e40c-92d9-11e5-88b1-b4984aaca59a.jpg)

Repeated periodicaly when I make a http/https requests. Code from https://github.com/godotengine/godot/wiki/http_client without "OS.delay" because with delays repeated frequently

data.title: Cannot override animations in inherited scene
data.body:
In inherited scenes, when modifying animations in an AnimationPlayer node inherited from the base scene, those modifications are lost when saving and reopening the inherited scene.

Would be amazing if you could add tracks to animations from base scenes and add keys to tracks from base scenes.
But at least it should be possible to override animations.

data.title: Add an ending " to main.cpp
data.body: Fix a regression from 00ddb532

data.title: Fix typo, missing quote
Document string <-> byte conversion methods
data.body: Document the methods to convert Strings to RawArrays, and back.

data.title: Dead links for variant and Error types
data.body:
Example:
- [PacketPeer](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/wiki/class_packetpeer) , method `put_var`, param is typed `var`. (can be found in Dictionary class as well).
- [PacketPeerUDP](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/wiki/class_packetpeerudp) , method `wait` , return value is typed `Error`.

Both are shown as clickable in the help browser. Both lead to empty pages. Ideally, they should point to documentation pages of the types.

data.title: Scene tree not updating on tab change in some conditions
data.body:
This is a weird bug I found by accident. The scene tree panel is not updating if you change the tab, but this does not seem to happen every time. I found a reliable way to reproduce this though:
- Create a new project (or open an existing one and close every scene).
- Add a new Node2D to the empty scene (this bug does not happen with a Control, only with Node2D and maybe with its descendants).
- Add a built-in script (just so you don't have to save the scene or type a path).
- Create a new scene.
- Go back to the first scene tab. Then the scene tree panel will remain empty.

The panel remains empty even if you switch back to the 2D view.

Related to #2386

I preferred to import the sub-scene automatically as root's child rather than showing an error. Is it fine?

data.title: ERROR: get_path: Condition ' !is_inside_tree() ' is true - when closing the editor
data.body:
When closing an open project to return to the project manager, the following messages are shown:

```
ERROR: get_path: Condition ' !is_inside_tree() ' is true. returned: NodePath()
   At: scene/main/node.cpp:1153.
ERROR: get_path: Condition ' !is_inside_tree() ' is true. returned: NodePath()
   At: scene/main/node.cpp:1153.
ERROR: get_path: Condition ' !is_inside_tree() ' is true. returned: NodePath()
   At: scene/main/node.cpp:1153.
ERROR: get_path: Condition ' !is_inside_tree() ' is true. returned: NodePath()
   At: scene/main/node.cpp:1153.
```

There are repeats several times, but it varies based on the project.

data.title: ERROR: _get_modified_time when trying to save a new scene for the first time
data.body:
Seen on Linux when opening the save scene dialog to save a new scene for the first.
i.e. start an empty project, add a root node, select "Save Scene As.." and the error shows up, probably because it tries to assess the presence of a "new_scene.scn" file since it's the default save name.

```
ERROR IN: res://new_scene.scn
ERROR: _get_modified_time: Method/Function Failed, returning: 0
   At: drivers/unix/file_access_unix.cpp:236.
```

data.title: Classes List dialog won't show up if no tab is open in script editor.
data.body:
Steps to recreate:
- Close every script and help tab in the script editor.
- Click the "Classes" button (next to "Search Help)... It won't show up.
